author: theyyamdancer
title: The origins of Rosogollas
text: # 3 Thanks TD. There have been Bengali karigar (workers) in Jaipur since at-least nineteenth century and there're a few good shops that make this dish Bengali style. In fact, in Jaipur there're separate sections in each sweetshop for what is called 'Bangali mithaee' (Bengali sweets). This distinction is important for us as Rasgulla is done very differently in Bikaner - it's much harder and the syrup thicker. It's called Bikaneri Rasgulla. I dont like it much. The wikitalk page on Rasgulla origins is hilarious - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk%3...mple_tradition
